## Overview

The Thailand National Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance Center (Thai-NARST) operates under the Ministry of Public Health to monitor antimicrobial resistance patterns across Thailand. Thai-NARST coordinates surveillance activities and provides data to support national AMR control strategies and clinical treatment guidelines.

## Key Features

- **Nationwide Network**: Participating hospitals across all regions of Thailand
- **Long-Term Surveillance**: Decades of resistance monitoring data
- **Clinical Focus**: Priority pathogens from various clinical specimens
- **Standardized Methods**: Quality-controlled testing protocols
- **Regular Reporting**: Annual reports and data dissemination
- **Capacity Building**: Training and support for laboratory networks

## Use Cases in Research

- Thai national AMR trends and epidemiology
- Southeast Asian resistance pattern comparisons
- Impact of antimicrobial stewardship programs
- Regional variation in resistance
- Healthcare-associated infection research
- Treatment guideline evidence base

## Getting Started

Visit the [Thai-NARST website](https://narst.dmsc.moph.go.th/) to access surveillance data and reports.
